solution_line_template: She uses {gallons_per_car} x {num_cars} = <<{gallons_per_car}*{num_cars}={water_for_cars}>>{water_for_cars} gallons of water to clean the two cars.
She uses {water_for_cars} - {less_gallons_for_plants} = <<{water_for_cars}-{less_gallons_for_plants}={water_for_plants}>>{water_for_plants} gallons of water to water the plants.

The total gallons of water that she uses to clean the cars and to water the plants is {water_for_cars} + {water_for_plants} = <<{water_for_cars}+{water_for_plants}={total_water_used_initial}>>{total_water_used_initial}.

Jan has {initial_gallons} - {total_water_used_initial} = <<{initial_gallons}-{total_water_used_initial}={remaining_gallons_after_initial_use}>>{remaining_gallons_after_initial_use} gallons of water remaining after cleaning the cars and watering the plants.

Jan uses {remaining_gallons_after_initial_use} / {divisor_for_plates_clothes} = <<{remaining_gallons_after_initial_use}/{divisor_for_plates_clothes}={water_for_plates_clothes}>>{water_for_plates_clothes} gallons of water to wash her plates and clothes.
